attribute.name: who
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the person, or group of people, to whom the element content is ascribed.

attribute.name: key
attribute.a:documentation: provides an externally-defined means of identifying the entity (or entities) being named, using a coded value of some kind.

attribute.name: ref
attribute.a:documentation: (reference) provides an explicit means of locating a full definition for the entity being named by means of one or more URIs.

attribute.name: atLeast
attribute.a:documentation: gives a minimum estimated value for the approximate measurement.

attribute.name: atMost
attribute.a:documentation: gives a maximum estimated value for the approximate measurement.

attribute.name: min
attribute.a:documentation: where the measurement summarizes more than one observation or a range, supplies the minimum value observed.

attribute.name: max
attribute.a:documentation: where the measurement summarizes more than one observation or a range, supplies the maximum value observed.

attribute.name: confidence
attribute.a:documentation: The degree of statistical confidence (between zero and one) that a value falls within the range specified by min and max, or the proportion of observed values that fall within that range.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.a:documentation: names the unit used for the measurement Suggested values include: 1] cm(centimetres) ; 2] mm(millimetres) ; 3] in(inches) ; 4] lines; 5] chars(characters)

choice.a:documentation: (centimetres)
(millimetres)
(inches)
lines of text
(characters) characters of text

attribute.name: quantity
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the length in the units specified

attribute.name: extent
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the size of the object concerned using a project-specific vocabulary combining quantity and units in a single string of words.

attribute.name: precision
attribute.a:documentation: characterizes the precision of the values specified by the other attributes.

attribute.name: scope
attribute.a:documentation: where the measurement summarizes more than one observation, specifies the applicability of this measurement. Sample values include: 1] all; 2] most; 3] range

attribute.name: break
attribute.a:documentation: indicates whether or not the element bearing this attribute should be considered to mark the end of an orthographic token in the same way as whitespace.

attribute.name: when
attribute.a:documentation: supplies the value of the date or time in a standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

attribute.name: notBefore
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the earliest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

attribute.name: notAfter
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the latest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

attribute.name: from
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the starting point of the period in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

attribute.name: to
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the ending point of the period in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

attribute.name: calendar
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the system or calendar to which the date represented by the content of this element belongs.

attribute.name: period
attribute.a:documentation: supplies a pointer to some location defining a named period of time within which the datable item is understood to have occurred.

attribute.name: default
attribute.a:documentation: indicates whether or not this element is selected by default when its parent is selected.

choice.a:documentation: This element is selected if its parent is selected
This element can only be selected explicitly, unless it is the only one of its kind, in which case it is selected if its parent is selected.

attribute.name: decls
attribute.a:documentation: identifies one or more declarable elements within the header, which are understood to apply to the element bearing this attribute and its content.

attribute.name: org
attribute.a:documentation: (organization) specifies how the content of the division is organized.

choice.a:documentation: composite content: i.e. no claim is made about the sequence in which the immediate contents of this division are to be processed, or their inter-relationships.
uniform content: i.e. the immediate contents of this element are regarded as forming a logical unit, to be processed in sequence.

attribute.name: sample
attribute.a:documentation: indicates whether this division is a sample of the original source and if so, from which part.

choice.a:documentation: division lacks material present at end in source.
division lacks material at start and end.
division lacks material at start.
position of sampled material within original unknown.
division is not a sample.

attribute.name: part
attribute.a:documentation: specifies whether or not the division is fragmented by some other structural element, for example a speech which is divided between two or more verse stanzas.

choice.a:documentation: (yes) the division is incomplete in some respect
(no) either the division is complete, or no claim is made as to its completeness.
(initial) the initial part of an incomplete division
(medial) a medial part of an incomplete division
(final) the final part of an incomplete division

attribute.name: status
attribute.a:documentation: describes the status of a document either currently or, when associated with a dated element, at the time indicated. Sample values include: 1] approved; 2] candidate; 3] cleared; 4] deprecated; 5] draft; 6] embargoed; 7] expired; 8] frozen; 9] galley; 10] proposed; 11] published; 12] recommendation; 13] submitted; 14] unfinished; 15] withdrawn

attribute.name: cert
attribute.a:documentation: (certainty) signifies the degree of certainty associated with the intervention or interpretation.

attribute.name: resp
attribute.a:documentation: (responsible party) indicates the agency responsible for the intervention or interpretation, for example an editor or transcriber.

attribute.name: evidence
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the nature of the evidence supporting the reliability or accuracy of the intervention or interpretation. Suggested values include: 1] internal; 2] external; 3] conjecture

choice.a:documentation: there is internal evidence to support the intervention.
there is external evidence to support the intervention.
the intervention or interpretation has been made by the editor, cataloguer, or scholar on the basis of their expertise.
there is internal evidence to support the intervention.
there is external evidence to support the intervention.
the intervention or interpretation has been made by the editor, cataloguer, or scholar on the basis of their expertise.

attribute.name: source
attribute.a:documentation: contains a list of one or more pointers indicating sources supporting the given intervention or interpretation.

attribute.name: instant
attribute.a:documentation: Is this an instant revision?

attribute.name: xml:id
attribute.a:documentation: (identifier) provides a unique identifier for the element bearing the attribute.

attribute.name: n
attribute.a:documentation: (number) gives a number (or other label) for an element, which is not necessarily unique within the document.

attribute.name: xml:lang
attribute.a:documentation: (language) indicates the language of the element content using a tag generated according to BCP 47

attribute.name: rend
attribute.a:documentation: (rendition) indicates how the element in question was rendered or presented in the source text.

attribute.name: xml:base
attribute.a:documentation: provides a base URI reference with which applications can resolve relative URI references into absolute URI references.

attribute.name: xml:space
attribute.a:documentation: signals an intention about how white space should be managed by applications.

choice.a:documentation: the processor should treat white space according to the default XML white space handling rules
the processor should preserve unchanged any and all white space in the source

attribute.name: scribe
attribute.a:documentation: gives a name or other identifier for the scribe believed to be responsible for this hand.

attribute.name: scribeRef
attribute.a:documentation: points to a full description of the scribe concerned, typically supplied by a person element elsewhere in the description.

attribute.name: script
attribute.a:documentation: characterizes the particular script or writing style used by this hand, for example secretary, copperplate, Chancery, Italian, etc.

attribute.name: scriptRef
attribute.a:documentation: points to a full description of the script or writing style used by this hand, typically supplied by a scriptNote element elsewhere in the description.

attribute.name: medium
attribute.a:documentation: describes the tint or type of ink, e.g. brown, or other writing medium, e.g. pencil

attribute.name: scope
attribute.a:documentation: specifies how widely this hand is used in the manuscript.

choice.a:documentation: only this hand is used throughout the manuscript
this hand is used through most of the manuscript
this hand is used occasionally in the manuscript

attribute.name: mimeType
attribute.a:documentation: (MIME media type) specifies the applicable multimedia internet mail extension (MIME) media type

attribute.name: type
attribute.a:documentation: indicates what kind of phenomenon is being noted in the passage. Sample values include: 1] image; 2] character; 3] theme; 4] allusion

attribute.name: inst
attribute.a:documentation: (instances) points to instances of the analysis or interpretation represented by the current element.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the units used for the measurement, usually using the standard symbol for the desired units. Suggested values include: 1] m(metre) ; 2] kg(kilogram) ; 3] s(second) ; 4] Hz(hertz) ; 5] Pa(pascal) ; 6] Ω(ohm) ; 7] L(litre) ; 8] t(tonne) ; 9] ha(hectare) ; 10] Å(ångström) ; 11] mL(millilitre) ; 12] cm(centimetre) ; 13] dB(decibel) ; 14] kbit(kilobit) ; 15] Kibit(kibibit) ; 16] kB(kilobyte) ; 17] KiB(kibibyte) ; 18] MB(megabyte) ; 19] MiB(mebibyte)

choice.a:documentation: (metre) SI base unit of length
(kilogram) SI base unit of mass
(second) SI base unit of time
(hertz) SI unit of frequency
(pascal) SI unit of pressure or stress
(ohm) SI unit of electric resistance
(litre) 1 dm³
(tonne) 10³ kg
(hectare) 1 hm²
(ångström) 10⁻¹⁰ m
(millilitre)
(centimetre)
(decibel) see remarks, below
(kilobit) 10³ or 1000 bits
(kibibit) 2¹⁰ or 1024 bits
(kilobyte) 10³ or 1000 bytes
(kibibyte) 2¹⁰ or 1024 bytes
(megabyte) 10⁶ or 1 000 000 bytes
(mebibyte) 2²⁰ or 1 048 576 bytes

attribute.name: quantity
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the number of the specified units that comprise the measurement

attribute.name: commodity
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the substance that is being measured

attribute.name: role
attribute.a:documentation: may be used to specify further information about the entity referenced by this name, for example the occupation of a person, or the status of a place.

attribute.name: nymRef
attribute.a:documentation: (reference to the canonical name) provides a means of locating the canonical form (nym) of the names associated with the object named by the element bearing it.

attribute.name: place
attribute.a:documentation: Suggested values include: 1] below; 2] bottom; 3] margin; 4] top; 5] opposite; 6] overleaf; 7] above; 8] end; 9] inline; 10] inspace

choice.a:documentation: below the line
at the foot of the page
in the margin (left, right, or both)
at the top of the page
on the opposite, i.e. facing, page
on the other side of the leaf
above the line
at the end of e.g. chapter or volume.
within the body of the text.
in a predefined space, for example left by an earlier scribe.
below the line
at the foot of the page
in the margin (left, right, or both)
at the top of the page
on the opposite, i.e. facing, page
on the other side of the leaf
above the line
at the end of e.g. chapter or volume.
within the body of the text.
in a predefined space, for example left by an earlier scribe.

attribute.name: type
attribute.a:documentation: characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

attribute.name: subtype
attribute.a:documentation: provides a sub-categorization of the element, if needed

attribute.name: target
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the destination of the reference by supplying one or more URI References

attribute.name: evaluate
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the intended meaning when the target of a pointer is itself a pointer.

choice.a:documentation: if the element pointed to is itself a pointer, then the target of that pointer will be taken, and so on, until an element is found which is not a pointer.
if the element pointed to is itself a pointer, then its target (whether a pointer or not) is taken as the target of this pointer.
no further evaluation of targets is carried out beyond that needed to find the element specified in the pointer's target.

attribute.name: target
attribute.a:documentation: points at one or several elements or sets of elements by means of one or more data pointers, using the URI syntax.

attribute.name: match
attribute.a:documentation: supplies an arbitrary XPath expression identifying a set of nodes, selected within the context identified by the target attribute if this is supplied, or within the context of the element bearing this attribute if it is not.

attribute.name: function
attribute.a:documentation: characterizes the function of the segment.

attribute.name: part
attribute.a:documentation: specifies whether or not the segment is fragmented by some other structural element, for example a clause which is divided between two or more sentences.

choice.a:documentation: (yes) the segment is incomplete in some respect
(no) either the segment is complete, or no claim is made as to its completeness
(initial) the initial part of an incomplete segment
(medial) a medial part of an incomplete segment
(final) the final part of an incomplete segment

attribute.name: sortKey
attribute.a:documentation: supplies the sort key for this element in an index, list or group which contains it.

attribute.name: ed
attribute.a:documentation: (edition) supplies an arbitrary identifier for the source edition in which the associated feature (for example, a page, column, or line break) occurs at this point in the text.

attribute.name: spanTo
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the end of a span initiated by the element bearing this attribute.

attribute.name: role
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the kind of information held in this cell or in each cell of this row. Suggested values include: 1] label; 2] data

choice.a:documentation: labelling or descriptive information only.
data values.

attribute.name: rows
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the number of rows occupied by this cell or row.

attribute.name: cols
attribute.a:documentation: (columns) indicates the number of columns occupied by this cell or row.

attribute.name: hand
attribute.a:documentation: signifies the hand of the agent which made the intervention.

attribute.name: status
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the effect of the intervention, for example in the case of a deletion, strikeouts which include too much or too little text, or in the case of an addition, an insertion which duplicates some of the text already present. Sample values include: 1] duplicate; 2] duplicate-partial; 3] excessStart; 4] excessEnd; 5] shortStart; 6] shortEnd; 7] partial; 8] unremarkable

attribute.name: cause
attribute.a:documentation: documents the presumed cause for the intervention.

choice.a:documentation: repeated for the purpose of fixation
repeated to clarify a previously illegible or badly written text or mark

attribute.name: seq
attribute.a:documentation: (sequence) assigns a sequence number related to the order in which the encoded features carrying this attribute are believed to have occurred.

attribute.name: version
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the version name or number of the source from which the translated version was derived

attribute.name: full
attribute.a:documentation: indicates whether the name component is given in full, as an abbreviation or simply as an initial.

choice.a:documentation: the name component is spelled out in full.
(abbreviated) the name component is given in an abbreviated form.
(initial letter) the name component is indicated only by one initial.

attribute.name: sort
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the sort order of the name component in relation to others within the personal name.

element.name: p
element.a:documentation: (paragraph) marks paragraphs in prose. [3.1. 7.2.5. ]

element.name: foreign
element.a:documentation: (foreign) identifies a word or phrase as belonging to some language other than that of the surrounding text. [3.3.2.1. ]

element.name: emph
element.a:documentation: (emphasized) marks words or phrases which are stressed or emphasized for linguistic or rhetorical effect. [3.3.2.2. 3.3.2. ]

element.name: hi
element.a:documentation: (highlighted) marks a word or phrase as graphically distinct from the surrounding text, for reasons concerning which no claim is made. [3.3.2.2. 3.3.2. ]

element.name: said
element.a:documentation: (speech or thought) indicates passages thought or spoken aloud, whether explicitly indicated in the source or not, whether directly or indirectly reported, whether by real people or fictional characters. [3.3.3. ]

attribute.name: aloud
attribute.a:documentation: may be used to indicate whether the quoted matter is regarded as having been vocalized or signed.

attribute.name: direct
attribute.a:documentation: may be used to indicate whether the quoted matter is regarded as direct or indirect speech.

element.name: quote
element.a:documentation: (quotation) contains a phrase or passage attributed by the narrator or author to some agency external to the text. [3.3.3. 4.3.1. ]

element.name: q
element.a:documentation: (separated from the surrounding text with quotation marks) contains material which is marked as (ostensibly) being somehow different than the surrounding text, for any one of a variety of reasons including, but not limited to: direct speech or thought, technical terms or jargon, authorial distance, quotations from elsewhere, and passages that are mentioned but not used. [3.3.3. ]

attribute.name: type
attribute.a:documentation: may be used to indicate whether the offset passage is spoken or thought, or to characterize it more finely. Suggested values include: 1] spoken; 2] thought; 3] written; 4] soCalled; 5] foreign(foreign words) ; 6] distinct(linguistically distinct) ; 7] term(technical term) ; 8] emph(rhetorically emphasized) ; 9] mentioned

choice.a:documentation: representation of speech
representation of thought, e.g. internal monologue
quotation from a written source
authorial distance
(foreign words)
(linguistically distinct)
(technical term)
(rhetorically emphasized)
refering to itself, not its normal referant

element.name: cit
element.a:documentation: (cited quotation) contains a quotation from some other document, together with a bibliographic reference to its source. In a dictionary it may contain an example text with at least one occurrence of the word form, used in the sense being described, or a translation of the headword, or an example. [3.3.3. 4.3.1. 9.3.5.1. ]

element.name: mentioned
element.a:documentation: marks words or phrases mentioned, not used. [3.3.4. ]

element.name: soCalled
element.a:documentation: contains a word or phrase for which the author or narrator indicates a disclaiming of responsibility, for example by the use of scare quotes or italics. [3.3.3. ]

element.name: desc
element.a:documentation: (description) contains a brief description of the object documented by its parent element, including its intended usage, purpose, or application where this is appropriate. [22.4.4. 22.4.5. 22.4.6. 22.4.7. ]

element.name: gloss
element.a:documentation: identifies a phrase or word used to provide a gloss or definition for some other word or phrase. [3.3.4. ]

attribute.name: cRef
attribute.a:documentation: (canonical reference) identifies the associated term element using a canonical reference from a scheme defined in a refsDecl element in the TEI header

element.name: term
element.a:documentation: contains a single-word, multi-word, or symbolic designation which is regarded as a technical term. [3.3.4. ]

attribute.name: cRef
attribute.a:documentation: identifies the associated gloss element using a canonical reference from a scheme defined in a refsDecl element in the TEI header

element.name: sic
element.a:documentation: (latin for thus or so ) contains text reproduced although apparently incorrect or inaccurate. [3.4.1. ]

element.name: corr
element.a:documentation: (correction) contains the correct form of a passage apparently erroneous in the copy text. [3.4.1. ]

element.name: choice
element.a:documentation: groups a number of alternative encodings for the same point in a text. [3.4. ]

element.name: reg
element.a:documentation: (regularization) contains a reading which has been regularized or normalized in some sense. [3.4.2. 12. ]

element.name: orig
element.a:documentation: (original form) contains a reading which is marked as following the original, rather than being normalized or corrected. [3.4.2. 12. ]

element.name: gap
element.a:documentation: (gap) indicates a point where material has been omitted in a transcription, whether for editorial reasons described in the TEI header, as part of sampling practice, or because the material is illegible, invisible, or inaudible. [3.4.3. ]

attribute.name: reason
attribute.a:documentation: gives the reason for omission. Sample values include sampling, inaudible, irrelevant, cancelled.

attribute.name: hand
attribute.a:documentation: in the case of text omitted from the transcription because of deliberate deletion by an identifiable hand, signifies the hand which made the deletion.

attribute.name: agent
attribute.a:documentation: In the case of text omitted because of damage, categorizes the cause of the damage, if it can be identified. Sample values include: 1] rubbing; 2] mildew; 3] smoke

element.name: add
element.a:documentation: (addition) contains letters, words, or phrases inserted in the text by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector. [3.4.3. ]

element.name: del
element.a:documentation: (deletion) contains a letter, word, or passage deleted, marked as deleted, or otherwise indicated as superfluous or spurious in the copy text by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector. [3.4.3. ]

element.name: unclear
element.a:documentation: contains a word, phrase, or passage which cannot be transcribed with certainty because it is illegible or inaudible in the source. [11.3.3.1. 3.4.3. ]

attribute.name: reason
attribute.a:documentation: indicates why the material is hard to transcribe.

attribute.name: hand
attribute.a:documentation: Where the difficulty in transcription arises from action (partial deletion, etc.) assignable to an identifiable hand, signifies the hand responsible for the action.

attribute.name: agent
attribute.a:documentation: Where the difficulty in transcription arises from damage, categorizes the cause of the damage, if it can be identified. Sample values include: 1] rubbing; 2] mildew; 3] smoke

element.name: name
element.a:documentation: (name, proper noun) contains a proper noun or noun phrase. [3.5.1. ]

element.name: rs
element.a:documentation: (referencing string) contains a general purpose name or referring string. [13.2.1. 3.5.1. ]

attribute.name: type
attribute.a:documentation: indicates more specifically the object referred to by the referencing string. When suitable, values should be drawn from an existing ontology, such as the BBN's proposed answer categories.

element.name: address
element.a:documentation: contains a postal address, for example of a publisher, an organization, or an individual. [3.5.2. 2.2.4. 3.11.2.3. ]

element.name: addrLine
element.a:documentation: (address line) contains one line of a postal address. [3.5.2. 2.2.4. 3.11.2.3. ]

element.name: num
element.a:documentation: (number) contains a number, written in any form. [3.5.3. ]

attribute.name: type
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the type of numeric value. Suggested values include: 1] cardinal; 2] ordinal; 3] fraction; 4] percentage

choice.a:documentation: absolute number, e.g. 21, 21.5
ordinal number, e.g. 21st
fraction, e.g. one half or three-quarters
a percentage

attribute.name: value
attribute.a:documentation: supplies the value of the number in standard form.

element.name: measureGrp
element.a:documentation: (measure group) contains a group of dimensional specifications which relate to the same object, for example the height and width of a manuscript page. [10.3.4. ]

element.name: time
element.a:documentation: contains a phrase defining a time of day in any format. [3.5.4. ]

element.name: abbr
element.a:documentation: (abbreviation) contains an abbreviation of any sort. [3.5.5. ]

attribute.name: type
attribute.a:documentation: allows the encoder to classify the abbreviation according to some convenient typology. Sample values include: 1] suspension; 2] contraction; 3] brevigraph; 4] superscription; 5] acronym; 6] title; 7] organization; 8] geographic

element.name: expan
element.a:documentation: (expansion) contains the expansion of an abbreviation. [3.5.5. ]

element.name: ptr
element.a:documentation: (pointer) defines a pointer to another location. [3.6. 16.1. ]

rule.report: Only one of the attributes 'target' and 'cRef' may be supplied.

attribute.name: cRef
attribute.a:documentation: (canonical reference) specifies the destination of the pointer by supplying a canonical reference from a scheme defined in a refsDecl element in the TEI header

element.name: ref
element.a:documentation: (reference) defines a reference to another location, possibly modified by additional text or comment. [3.6. 16.1. ]

rule.report: Only one of the attributes 'target' and 'cRef' may be supplied.

attribute.name: cRef
attribute.a:documentation: (canonical reference) specifies the destination of the reference by supplying a canonical reference from a scheme defined in a refsDecl element in the TEI header

element.name: list
element.a:documentation: (list) contains any sequence of items organized as a list. [3.7. ]

attribute.name: type
attribute.a:documentation: describes the form of the list. Suggested values include: 1] ordered; 2] bulleted; 3] simple; 4] gloss

choice.a:documentation: list items are numbered or lettered.
list items are marked with a bullet or other typographic device.
list items are not numbered or bulleted.
each list item glosses some term or concept, which is given by a label element preceding the list item.

element.name: item
element.a:documentation: contains one component of a list. [3.7. 2.5. ]

element.name: label
element.a:documentation: contains any label or heading used to identify part of a text, typically but not exclusively in a list or glossary. [3.7. ]

element.name: head
element.a:documentation: (heading) contains any type of heading, for example the title of a section, or the heading of a list, glossary, manuscript description, etc. [4.2.1. ]

element.name: note
element.a:documentation: contains a note or annotation. [3.8.1. 2.2.6. 3.11.2.6. 9.3.5.4. ]

attribute.name: anchored
attribute.a:documentation: indicates whether the copy text shows the exact place of reference for the note.

attribute.name: targetEnd
attribute.a:documentation: points to the end of the span to which the note is attached, if the note is not embedded in the text at that point.

element.name: index
element.a:documentation: (index entry) marks a location to be indexed for whatever purpose. [3.8.2. ]

attribute.name: indexName
attribute.a:documentation: supplies a name to specify which index (of several) the index entry belongs to.

element.name: graphic
element.a:documentation: indicates the location of an inline graphic, illustration, or figure. [3.9. ]

attribute.name: width
attribute.a:documentation: The display width of the image

attribute.name: height
attribute.a:documentation: The display height of the image

attribute.name: scale
attribute.a:documentation: A scale factor to be applied to the image to make it the desired display size

attribute.name: url
attribute.a:documentation: (uniform resource locator) A URL which refers to the image itself.

element.name: milestone
element.a:documentation: marks a boundary point separating any kind of section of a text, typically but not necessarily indicating a point at which some part of a standard reference system changes, where the change is not represented by a structural element. [3.10.3. ]

attribute.name: unit
attribute.a:documentation: provides a conventional name for the kind of section changing at this milestone. Suggested values include: 1] page; 2] column; 3] line; 4] book; 5] poem; 6] canto; 7] speaker; 8] stanza; 9] act; 10] scene; 11] section; 12] absent; 13] unnumbered

choice.a:documentation: physical page breaks (synonymous with the pb element).
column breaks.
line breaks (synonymous with the lb element).
any units termed book, liber, etc.
individual poems in a collection.
cantos or other major sections of a poem.
changes of speaker or narrator.
stanzas within a poem, book, or canto.
acts within a play.
scenes within a play or act.
sections of any kind.
passages not present in the reference edition.
passages present in the text, but not to be included as part of the reference.

element.name: gb
element.a:documentation: (gathering begins) marks the point in a transcribed codex at which a new gathering or quire begins. [3.10.3. ]

element.name: pb
element.a:documentation: (page break) marks the boundary between one page of a text and the next in a standard reference system. [3.10.3. ]

element.name: lb
element.a:documentation: (line break) marks the start of a new (typographic) line in some edition or version of a text. [3.10.3. 7.2.5. ]

element.name: author
element.a:documentation: in a bibliographic reference, contains the name(s) of an author, personal or corporate, of a work; for example in the same form as that provided by a recognized bibliographic name authority. [3.11.2.2. 2.2.1. ]

element.name: editor
element.a:documentation: secondary statement of responsibility for a bibliographic item, for example the name of an individual, institution or organization, (or of several such) acting as editor, compiler, translator, etc. [3.11.2.2. ]

element.name: respStmt
element.a:documentation: (statement of responsibility) supplies a statement of responsibility for the intellectual content of a text, edition, recording, or series, where the specialized elements for authors, editors, etc. do not suffice or do not apply. May also be used to encode information about individuals or organizations which have played a role in the production or distribution of a bibliographic work. [3.11.2.2. 2.2.1. 2.2.2. 2.2.5. ]

element.name: resp
element.a:documentation: (responsibility) contains a phrase describing the nature of a person's intellectual responsibility, or an organization's role in the production or distribution of a work. [3.11.2.2. 2.2.1. 2.2.2. 2.2.5. ]

element.name: title
element.a:documentation: contains a title for any kind of work. [3.11.2.2. 2.2.1. 2.2.5. ]

attribute.name: level
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the bibliographic level for a title, that is, whether it identifies an article, book, journal, series, or unpublished material.

choice.a:documentation: (analytic) analytic title (article, poem, or other item published as part of a larger item)
(monographic) monographic title (book, collection, or other item published as a distinct item, including single volumes of multi-volume works)
(journal) journal title
(series) series title
(unpublished) title of unpublished material (including theses and dissertations unless published by a commercial press)

attribute.name: type
attribute.a:documentation: classifies the title according to some convenient typology. Sample values include: 1] main; 2] sub(subordinate) ; 3] alt(alternate) ; 4] short; 5] desc(descriptive)

element.name: publisher
element.a:documentation: provides the name of the organization responsible for the publication or distribution of a bibliographic item. [3.11.2.3. 2.2.4. ]

element.name: biblScope
element.a:documentation: (scope of citation) defines the scope of a bibliographic reference, for example as a list of page numbers, or a named subdivision of a larger work. [3.11.2.3. ]

attribute.name: type
attribute.a:documentation: identifies the type of information conveyed by the element, e.g. columns, pages, volume. Suggested values include: 1] vol(volume) ; 2] issue; 3] pp(pages) ; 4] ll (lines) ; 5] chap(chapter) ; 6] part

choice.a:documentation: (volume) the element contains a volume number.
the element contains an issue number, or volume and issue numbers.
(pages) the element contains a page number or page range.
(lines) the element contains a line number or line range.
(chapter) the element contains a chapter indication (number and/or title)
the element identifies a part of a book or collection.

attribute.name: from
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the starting point of the range of units indicated by the type attribute.

attribute.name: to
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the end-point of the range of units indicated by the type attribute.

element.name: pubPlace
element.a:documentation: (publication place) contains the name of the place where a bibliographic item was published. [3.11.2.3. ]

element.name: bibl
element.a:documentation: (bibliographic citation) contains a loosely-structured bibliographic citation of which the sub-components may or may not be explicitly tagged. [3.11.1. 2.2.7. 15.3.2. ]

element.name: listBibl
element.a:documentation: (citation list) contains a list of bibliographic citations of any kind. [3.11.1. 2.2.7. 15.3.2. ]

element.name: relatedItem
element.a:documentation: contains or references some other bibliographic item which is related to the present one in some specified manner, for example as a constituent or alternative version of it. [3.11.2.5. ]

rule.sch:report: If the 'target' attribute is used, the relatedItem element must be empty

rule.sch:assert: A relatedItem element should have either a 'target' attribute or a child element to indicate the related bibliographic item

attribute.name: target
attribute.a:documentation: points to the related bibliographic element by means of an absolute or relative URI reference

element.name: l
element.a:documentation: (verse line) contains a single, possibly incomplete, line of verse. [3.12.1. 3.12. 7.2.5. ]

attribute.name: part
attribute.a:documentation: specifies whether or not the line is metrically complete.

choice.a:documentation: (yes) the line is metrically incomplete
(no) either the line is complete, or no claim is made as to its completeness
(initial) the initial part of an incomplete line
(medial) a medial part of an incomplete line
(final) the final part of an incomplete line

element.name: lg
element.a:documentation: (line group) contains a group of verse lines functioning as a formal unit, e.g. a stanza, refrain, verse paragraph, etc. [3.12.1. 3.12. 7.2.5. ]

element.name: sp
element.a:documentation: (speech) An individual speech in a performance text, or a passage presented as such in a prose or verse text. [3.12.2. 3.12. 7.2.2. ]

element.name: speaker
element.a:documentation: A specialized form of heading or label, giving the name of one or more speakers in a dramatic text or fragment. [3.12.2. ]

element.name: stage
element.a:documentation: (stage direction) contains any kind of stage direction within a dramatic text or fragment. [3.12.2. 3.12. 7.2.4. ]

attribute.name: type
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the kind of stage direction. Suggested values include: 1] setting; 2] entrance; 3] exit; 4] business; 5] novelistic; 6] delivery; 7] modifier; 8] location; 9] mixed

choice.a:documentation: describes a setting.
describes an entrance.
describes an exit.
describes stage business.
is a narrative, motivating stage direction.
describes how a character speaks.
gives some detail about a character.
describes a location.
more than one of the above

element.name: teiCorpus
element.a:documentation: contains the whole of a TEI encoded corpus, comprising a single corpus header and one or more TEI elements, each containing a single text header and a text. [4. 15.1. ]

attribute.name: version
attribute.a:documentation: The version of the TEI scheme

element.name: divGen
element.a:documentation: (automatically generated text division) indicates the location at which a textual division generated automatically by a text-processing application is to appear. [3.8.2. ]

attribute.name: type
attribute.a:documentation: specifies what type of generated text division (e.g. index, table of contents, etc.) is to appear. Sample values include: 1] index; 2] toc; 3] figlist; 4] tablist

element.name: textLang
element.a:documentation: (text language) describes the languages and writing systems identified within the bibliographic work being described, rather than its description. [3.11.2.3. 10.6.6. ]

attribute.name: mainLang
attribute.a:documentation: (main language) supplies a code which identifies the chief language used in the bibliographic work.

attribute.name: otherLangs
attribute.a:documentation: (other languages) one or more codes identifying any other languages used in the bibliographic work.

element.name: teiHeader
element.a:documentation: (TEI Header) supplies the descriptive and declarative information making up an electronic title page prefixed to every TEI-conformant text. [2.1.1. 15.1. ]

attribute.name: type
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the kind of document to which the header is attached, for example whether it is a corpus or individual text. Sample values include: 1] text; 2] corpus

element.name: fileDesc
element.a:documentation: (file description) contains a full bibliographic description of an electronic file. [2.2. 2.1.1. ]

element.name: titleStmt
element.a:documentation: (title statement) groups information about the title of a work and those responsible for its intellectual content. [2.2.1. 2.2. ]

element.name: sponsor
element.a:documentation: specifies the name of a sponsoring organization or institution. [2.2.1. ]

element.name: funder
element.a:documentation: (funding body) specifies the name of an individual, institution, or organization responsible for the funding of a project or text. [2.2.1. ]

element.name: principal
element.a:documentation: (principal researcher) supplies the name of the principal researcher responsible for the creation of an electronic text. [2.2.1. ]

element.name: editionStmt
element.a:documentation: (edition statement) groups information relating to one edition of a text. [2.2.2. 2.2. ]

element.name: edition
element.a:documentation: (edition) describes the particularities of one edition of a text. [2.2.2. ]

element.name: extent
element.a:documentation: describes the approximate size of a text as stored on some carrier medium, whether digital or non-digital, specified in any convenient units. [2.2.3. 2.2. 3.11.2.3. ]

element.name: publicationStmt
element.a:documentation: (publication statement) groups information concerning the publication or distribution of an electronic or other text. [2.2.4. 2.2. ]

element.name: distributor
element.a:documentation: supplies the name of a person or other agency responsible for the distribution of a text. [2.2.4. ]

element.name: authority
element.a:documentation: (release authority) supplies the name of a person or other agency responsible for making an electronic file available, other than a publisher or distributor. [2.2.4. ]

element.name: idno
element.a:documentation: (identifier) supplies any form of identifier used to identify some object, such as a bibliographic item, a person, a title, an organization, etc. in a standardized way. [2.2.4. 2.2.5. 3.11.2.3. ]

attribute.name: type
attribute.a:documentation: categorizes the identifier, for example as an ISBN, Social Security number, etc.

element.name: availability
element.a:documentation: supplies information about the availability of a text, for example any restrictions on its use or distribution, its copyright status, any licence applying to it, etc. [2.2.4. ]

attribute.name: status
attribute.a:documentation: supplies a code identifying the current availability of the text.

choice.a:documentation: the text is freely available.
the status of the text is unknown.
the text is not freely available.

element.name: licence
element.a:documentation: contains information about a licence or other legal agreement applicable to the text. [2.2.4. ]

element.name: seriesStmt
element.a:documentation: (series statement) groups information about the series, if any, to which a publication belongs. [2.2.5. 2.2. ]

element.name: notesStmt
element.a:documentation: (notes statement) collects together any notes providing information about a text additional to that recorded in other parts of the bibliographic description. [2.2.6. 2.2. ]

element.name: sourceDesc
element.a:documentation: (source description) describes the source from which an electronic text was derived or generated, typically a bibliographic description in the case of a digitized text, or a phrase such as "born digital" for a text which has no previous existence. [2.2.7. ]

element.name: biblFull
element.a:documentation: (fully-structured bibliographic citation) contains a fully-structured bibliographic citation, in which all components of the TEI file description are present. [3.11.1. 2.2. 2.2.7. 15.3.2. ]

element.name: encodingDesc
element.a:documentation: (encoding description) documents the relationship between an electronic text and the source or sources from which it was derived. [2.3. 2.1.1. ]

element.name: projectDesc
element.a:documentation: (project description) describes in detail the aim or purpose for which an electronic file was encoded, together with any other relevant information concerning the process by which it was assembled or collected. [2.3.1. 2.3. 15.3.2. ]

element.name: samplingDecl
element.a:documentation: (sampling declaration) contains a prose description of the rationale and methods used in sampling texts in the creation of a corpus or collection. [2.3.2. 2.3. 15.3.2. ]

element.name: editorialDecl
element.a:documentation: (editorial practice declaration) provides details of editorial principles and practices applied during the encoding of a text. [2.3.3. 2.3. 15.3.2. ]

element.name: refsDecl
element.a:documentation: (references declaration) specifies how canonical references are constructed for this text. [2.3.5.3. 2.3. 2.3.5. ]

element.name: cRefPattern
element.a:documentation: (canonical reference pattern) specifies an expression and replacement pattern for transforming a canonical reference into a URI. [2.3.5.3. 2.3.5. 2.3.5.2. ]

attribute.name: matchPattern
attribute.a:documentation: specifies a regular expression against which the values of cRef attributes can be matched.

attribute.name: replacementPattern
attribute.a:documentation: specifies a replacement pattern which, once subpattern substitution has been performed, provides a URI.

element.name: refState
element.a:documentation: (reference state) specifies one component of a canonical reference defined by the milestone method. [2.3.5.3. 2.3.5. ]

attribute.name: unit
attribute.a:documentation: indicates what kind of state is changing at this milestone. Suggested values include: 1] page; 2] column; 3] line; 4] book; 5] poem; 6] canto; 7] stanza; 8] act; 9] scene; 10] section; 11] absent

choice.a:documentation: page breaks in the reference edition.
column breaks.
line breaks.
any units termed book, liber, etc.
individual poems in a collection.
cantos or other major sections of a poem.
stanzas within a poem, book, or canto.
acts within a play.
scenes within a play or act.
sections of any kind.
passages not present in the reference edition.

attribute.name: length
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the fixed length of the reference component.

attribute.name: delim
attribute.a:documentation: (delimiter) supplies a delimiting string following the reference component.

element.name: classDecl
element.a:documentation: (classification declarations) contains one or more taxonomies defining any classificatory codes used elsewhere in the text. [2.3.6. 2.3. ]

element.name: taxonomy
element.a:documentation: defines a typology either implicitly, by means of a bibliographic citation, or explicitly by a structured taxonomy. [2.3.6. ]

element.name: category
element.a:documentation: contains an individual descriptive category, possibly nested within a superordinate category, within a user-defined taxonomy. [2.3.6. ]

element.name: catDesc
element.a:documentation: (category description) describes some category within a taxonomy or text typology, either in the form of a brief prose description or in terms of the situational parameters used by the TEI formal textDesc. [2.3.6. ]

element.name: appInfo
element.a:documentation: (application information) records information about an application which has edited the TEI file.

element.name: application
element.a:documentation: provides information about an application which has acted upon the document.

attribute.name: ident
attribute.a:documentation: Supplies an identifier for the application, independent of its version number or display name.

attribute.name: version
attribute.a:documentation: Supplies a version number for the application, independent of its identifier or display name.

element.name: profileDesc
element.a:documentation: (text-profile description) provides a detailed description of non-bibliographic aspects of a text, specifically the languages and sublanguages used, the situation in which it was produced, the participants and their setting. [2.4. 2.1.1. ]

element.name: creation
element.a:documentation: contains information about the creation of a text. [2.4.1. 2.4. ]

element.name: langUsage
element.a:documentation: (language usage) describes the languages, sublanguages, registers, dialects, etc. represented within a text. [2.4.2. 2.4. 15.3.2. ]

element.name: language
element.a:documentation: characterizes a single language or sublanguage used within a text. [2.4.2. ]

attribute.name: ident
attribute.a:documentation: (identifier) Supplies a language code constructed as defined in BCP 47 which is used to identify the language documented by this element, and which is referenced by the global xml:lang attribute.

attribute.name: usage
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the approximate percentage (by volume) of the text which uses this language.

element.name: textClass
element.a:documentation: (text classification) groups information which describes the nature or topic of a text in terms of a standard classification scheme, thesaurus, etc. [2.4.3. ]

element.name: keywords
element.a:documentation: contains a list of keywords or phrases identifying the topic or nature of a text. [2.4.3. ]

attribute.name: scheme
attribute.a:documentation: identifies the controlled vocabulary within which the set of keywords concerned is defined.

element.name: classCode
element.a:documentation: (classification code) contains the classification code used for this text in some standard classification system. [2.4.3. ]

attribute.name: scheme
attribute.a:documentation: identifies the classification system or taxonomy in use.

element.name: catRef
element.a:documentation: (category reference) specifies one or more defined categories within some taxonomy or text typology. [2.4.3. ]

attribute.name: scheme
attribute.a:documentation: identifies the classification scheme within which the set of categories concerned is defined

element.name: calendarDesc
element.a:documentation: (calendar description) contains a description of the calendar system used in any dating expression found in the text. [2.4. 2.4.4. ]

element.name: calendar
element.a:documentation: describes a calendar or dating system used in a dating formula in the text. [2.4.4. ]

element.name: revisionDesc
element.a:documentation: (revision description) summarizes the revision history for a file. [2.5. 2.1.1. ]

element.name: change
element.a:documentation: documents a change or set of changes made during the production of a source document, or during the revision of an electronic file. [2.5. 2.4.1. ]

attribute.name: target
attribute.a:documentation: points to one or more elements that belong to this change.

element.name: listChange
element.a:documentation: groups a number of change descriptions associated with either the creation of a source text or the revision of an encoded text.

attribute.name: ordered
attribute.a:documentation: indicates whether the ordering of its child change elements is to be considered significant or not

element.name: geoDecl
element.a:documentation: (geographic coordinates declaration) documents the notation and the datum used for geographic coordinates expressed as content of the geo element elsewhere within the document.

attribute.name: datum
attribute.a:documentation: supplies a commonly used code name for the datum employed. Suggested values include: 1] WGS84(World Geodetic System) ; 2] MGRS(Military Grid Reference System) ; 3] OSGB36(ordnance survey great britain) ; 4] ED50(European Datum coordinate system)

choice.a:documentation: (World Geodetic System) a pair of numbers to be interpreted as latitude followed by longitude according to the World Geodetic System.
(Military Grid Reference System) the values supplied are geospatial entity object codes, based on
(ordnance survey great britain) the value supplied is to be interpreted as a British National Grid Reference.
(European Datum coordinate system) the value supplied is to be interpreted as latitude followed by longitude according to the European Datum coordinate system.

element.name: TEI
element.a:documentation: (TEI document) contains a single TEI-conformant document, comprising a TEI header and a text, either in isolation or as part of a teiCorpus element. [4. 15.1. ]

attribute.name: version
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the version number of the TEI Guidelines against which this document is valid.

element.name: text
element.a:documentation: contains a single text of any kind, whether unitary or composite, for example a poem or drama, a collection of essays, a novel, a dictionary, or a corpus sample. [4. 15.1. ]

element.name: body
element.a:documentation: (text body) contains the whole body of a single unitary text, excluding any front or back matter. [4. ]

element.name: group
element.a:documentation: contains the body of a composite text, grouping together a sequence of distinct texts (or groups of such texts) which are regarded as a unit for some purpose, for example the collected works of an author, a sequence of prose essays, etc. [4. 4.3.1. 15.1. ]

element.name: div
element.a:documentation: (text division) contains a subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text. [4.1. ]

element.name: trailer
element.a:documentation: contains a closing title or footer appearing at the end of a division of a text. [4.2.4. 4.2. ]

element.name: byline
element.a:documentation: contains the primary statement of responsibility given for a work on its title page or at the head or end of the work. [4.2.2. 4.5. ]

element.name: dateline
element.a:documentation: contains a brief description of the place, date, time, etc. of production of a letter, newspaper story, or other work, prefixed or suffixed to it as a kind of heading or trailer. [4.2.4. 4.2.2. ]

element.name: argument
element.a:documentation: A formal list or prose description of the topics addressed by a subdivision of a text. [4.2. 4.6. ]

element.name: epigraph
element.a:documentation: contains a quotation, anonymous or attributed, appearing at the start or end of a section or on a title page. [4.2.3. 4.2. 4.6. ]

element.name: opener
element.a:documentation: groups together dateline, byline, salutation, and similar phrases appearing as a preliminary group at the start of a division, especially of a letter. [4.2.4. 4.2. ]

element.name: closer
element.a:documentation: groups together salutations, datelines, and similar phrases appearing as a final group at the end of a division, especially of a letter. [4.2.2. 4.2. ]

element.name: salute
element.a:documentation: (salutation) contains a salutation or greeting prefixed to a foreword, dedicatory epistle, or other division of a text, or the salutation in the closing of a letter, preface, etc. [4.2.4. 4.2.2. ]

element.name: signed
element.a:documentation: (signature) contains the closing salutation, etc., appended to a foreword, dedicatory epistle, or other division of a text. [4.2.4. 4.2.2. ]

element.name: postscript
element.a:documentation: contains a postscript, e.g. to a letter. [4.2. ]

element.name: titlePage
element.a:documentation: (title page) contains the title page of a text, appearing within the front or back matter. [4.6. ]

attribute.name: type
attribute.a:documentation: classifies the title page according to any convenient typology.

element.name: docTitle
element.a:documentation: (document title) contains the title of a document, including all its constituents, as given on a title page. [4.6. ]

element.name: titlePart
element.a:documentation: contains a subsection or division of the title of a work, as indicated on a title page. [4.6. ]

attribute.name: type
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the role of this subdivision of the title. Suggested values include: 1] main; 2] sub(subordinate) ; 3] alt(alternate) ; 4] short; 5] desc(descriptive)

choice.a:documentation: main title of the work
(subordinate) subtitle of the work
(alternate) alternative title of the work
abbreviated form of title
(descriptive) descriptive paraphrase of the work

element.name: docAuthor
element.a:documentation: (document author) contains the name of the author of the document, as given on the title page (often but not always contained in a byline). [4.6. ]

element.name: docEdition
element.a:documentation: (document edition) contains an edition statement as presented on a title page of a document. [4.6. ]

element.name: docImprint
element.a:documentation: (document imprint) contains the imprint statement (place and date of publication, publisher name), as given (usually) at the foot of a title page. [4.6. ]

element.name: docDate
element.a:documentation: (document date) contains the date of a document, as given (usually) on a title page. [4.6. ]

attribute.name: when
attribute.a:documentation: gives the value of the date in standard form, i.e. YYYY-MM-DD.

element.name: front
element.a:documentation: (front matter) contains any prefatory matter (headers, title page, prefaces, dedications, etc.) found at the start of a document, before the main body. [4.6. 4. ]

element.name: back
element.a:documentation: (back matter) contains any appendixes, etc. following the main part of a text. [4.7. 4. ]

element.name: table
element.a:documentation: contains text displayed in tabular form, in rows and columns. [14.1.1. ]

attribute.name: rows
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the number of rows in the table.

attribute.name: cols
attribute.a:documentation: (columns) indicates the number of columns in each row of the table.

element.name: row
element.a:documentation: contains one row of a table. [14.1.1. ]

element.name: cell
element.a:documentation: contains one cell of a table. [14.1.1. ]

element.name: formula
element.a:documentation: contains a mathematical or other formula. [14.2. ]

attribute.name: notation
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the notation used for the content of the element.

element.name: notatedMusic
element.a:documentation: encodes the presence of music notation in a text

element.name: figure
element.a:documentation: groups elements representing or containing graphic information such as an illustration, formula, or figure. [14.4. ]

element.name: figDesc
element.a:documentation: (description of figure) contains a brief prose description of the appearance or content of a graphic figure, for use when documenting an image without displaying it. [14.4. ]

element.name: anchor
element.a:documentation: (anchor point) attaches an identifier to a point within a text, whether or not it corresponds with a textual element. [8.4.2. 16.4. ]

element.name: seg
element.a:documentation: (arbitrary segment) represents any segmentation of text below the chunk level. [16.3. 6.2. 7.2.5. ]

attribute.name: corresp
attribute.a:documentation: (corresponds) points to elements that correspond to the current element in some way.

attribute.name: synch
attribute.a:documentation: (synchronous) points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

attribute.name: sameAs
attribute.a:documentation: points to an element that is the same as the current element.

attribute.name: copyOf
attribute.a:documentation: points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

attribute.name: next
attribute.a:documentation: points to the next element of a virtual aggregate of which the current element is part.

attribute.name: prev
attribute.a:documentation: (previous) points to the previous element of a virtual aggregate of which the current element is part.

attribute.name: exclude
attribute.a:documentation: points to elements that are in exclusive alternation with the current element.

attribute.name: select
attribute.a:documentation: selects one or more alternants; if one alternant is selected, the ambiguity or uncertainty is marked as resolved. If more than one alternant is selected, the degree of ambiguity or uncertainty is marked as reduced by the number of alternants not selected.

element.name: s
element.a:documentation: (s-unit) contains a sentence-like division of a text. [17.1. 8.4.1. ]

rule.report: You may not nest one s element within another: use seg instead

element.name: pc
element.a:documentation: (punctuation character) a character or string of characters regarded as constituting a single punctuation mark. [17.1. ]

attribute.name: force
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the extent to which this punctuation mark conventionally separates words or phrases

choice.a:documentation: the punctuation mark is a word separator
the punctuation mark is not a word separator
the punctuation mark may or may not be a word separator

attribute.name: unit
attribute.a:documentation: provides a name for the kind of unit delimited by this punctuation mark.

attribute.name: pre
attribute.a:documentation: indicates whether this punctuation mark precedes or follows the unit it delimits.

attribute.name: ana
attribute.a:documentation: (analysis) indicates one or more elements containing interpretations of the element on which the ana attribute appears.

element.name: interp
element.a:documentation: (interpretation) summarizes a specific interpretative annotation which can be linked to a span of text. [17.3. ]

element.name: interpGrp
element.a:documentation: (interpretation group) collects together a set of related interpretations which share responsibility or type. [17.3. ]

element.name: att
element.a:documentation: (attribute) contains the name of an attribute appearing within running text. [22. ]

attribute.name: scheme
attribute.a:documentation: supplies an identifier for the scheme in which this name is defined. Sample values include: 1] TEI(text encoding initiative) ; 2] DBK(docbook) ; 3] XX(unknown)

element.name: code
element.a:documentation: contains literal code from some formal language such as a programming language.

attribute.name: lang
attribute.a:documentation: (formal language) a name identifying the formal language in which the code is expressed

element.name: eg
element.a:documentation: (example) contains any kind of illustrative example. [22.4.4. 22.4.5. ]

element.name: egXML
element.a:documentation: (example of XML) contains a single well-formed XML fragment demonstrating the use of some XML element or attribute, in which the egXML element itself functions as the root element. [22.4.4. 22.4.5. ]

attribute.name: valid
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the intended validity of the example with respect to a schema.

choice.a:documentation: the example is intended to be fully valid, assuming that its root element, or a provided root element, could have been used as a possible root element in the schema concerned.

the example could be transformed into a valid document by inserting any number of valid attributes and child elements anywhere within it; or it is valid against a version of the schema concerned in which the provision of character data, list, element, or attribute values has been made optional.
the example is not intended to be valid, and contains deliberate errors.

element.name: gi
element.a:documentation: (element name) contains the name (generic identifier) of an element. [22. 22.4.4. ]

attribute.name: scheme
attribute.a:documentation: supplies the name of the scheme in which this name is defined. Sample values include: 1] TEI(text encoding initiative) ; 2] DBK(docbook) ; 3] XX(unknown) ; 4] Schematron; 5] HTML

element.name: ident
element.a:documentation: (identifier) contains an identifier or name for an object of some kind in a formal language. ident is used for tokens such as variable names, class names, type names, function names etc. in formal programming languages. [22.1.1. ]

element.name: val
element.a:documentation: (value) contains a single attribute value. [22. 22.4.5. ]

element.name: precision
element.a:documentation: indicates the numerical accuracy or precision associated with some aspect of the text markup.

attribute.name: degree
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the degree of precision to be assigned as a value between 0 (none) and 1 (optimally precise)

attribute.name: precision
attribute.a:documentation: characterizes the precision of the element or attribute pointed to by the precision element.

attribute.name: stdDeviation
attribute.a:documentation: supplies a standard deviation associated with the value in question

element.name: certainty
element.a:documentation: indicates the degree of certainty associated with some aspect of the text markup. [21.1.2. ]

attribute.name: cert
attribute.a:documentation: (certainty) signifies the degree of certainty associated with the object pointed to by the certainty element.

attribute.name: locus
attribute.a:documentation: indicates more exactly the aspect concerning which certainty is being expressed: specifically, whether the markup is correctly located, whether the correct element or attribute name has been used, or whether the content of the element or attribute is correct, etc.

choice.a:documentation: uncertainty concerns whether the name of the element or attribute used is correctly applied.
uncertainty concerns whether the start of the element is correctly identified.
uncertainty concerns whether the end of the element is correctly identified.
uncertainty concerns both the start and the end of the element.
uncertainty concerns the content (for an element) or the value (for an attribute)

attribute.name: assertedValue
attribute.a:documentation: provides an alternative value for the aspect of the markup in question — an alternative generic identifier, transcription, or attribute value, or the identifier of an anchor element (to indicate an alternative starting or ending location). If an assertedValue is given, the confidence level specified by degree applies to the alternative markup specified by assertedValue; if none is given, it applies to the markup in the text.

attribute.name: given
attribute.a:documentation: indicates conditions assumed in the assignment of a degree of confidence.

attribute.name: degree
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the degree of confidence assigned to the aspect of the markup named by the locus attribute.

element.name: respons
element.a:documentation: (responsibility) identifies the individual(s) responsible for some aspect of the markup of particular element(s). [21.3. ]

attribute.name: locus
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the specific aspect of the markup for which responsibility is being assigned.

choice.a:documentation: responsibility is being assigned concerning the name of the element or attribute used.
responsibility is being assigned concerning the start of the element concerned.
responsibility is being assigned concerning the end of the element concerned.
responsibility is being assigned concerning the location of the element concerned.
responsibility is being assigned concerning the content (for an element) or the value (for an attribute)
responsibility is being assigned concerning the name of the element or attribute used.
responsibility is being assigned concerning the start of the element concerned.
responsibility is being assigned concerning the end of the element concerned.
responsibility is being assigned concerning the location of the element concerned.
responsibility is being assigned concerning the content (for an element) or the value (for an attribute)

attribute.name: resp
attribute.a:documentation: (responsible party) identifies the individual or agency responsible for the indicated aspect of the electronic text.

attribute.name: when-custom
attribute.a:documentation: supplies the value of a date or time in some standard form.

attribute.name: notBefore-custom
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the earliest possible date for the event in some custom standard form.

attribute.name: notAfter-custom
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the latest possible date for the event in some custom standard form.

attribute.name: from-custom
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the starting point of the period in some standard form.

attribute.name: to-custom
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the ending point of the period in some standard form.

attribute.name: datingPoint
attribute.a:documentation: supplies a pointer to some location defining a named point in time with reference to which the datable item is understood to have occurred

attribute.name: datingMethod
attribute.a:documentation: supplies a pointer to a calendarDesc element or other means of interpreting the values of the custom dating attributes.

element.name: orgName
element.a:documentation: (organization name) contains an organizational name. [13.2.2. ]

element.name: persName
element.a:documentation: (personal name) contains a proper noun or proper-noun phrase referring to a person, possibly including any or all of the person's forenames, surnames, honorifics, added names, etc. [13.2.1. ]

element.name: surname
element.a:documentation: contains a family (inherited) name, as opposed to a given, baptismal, or nick name. [13.2.1. ]

element.name: forename
element.a:documentation: contains a forename, given or baptismal name. [13.2.1. ]

element.name: genName
element.a:documentation: (generational name component) contains a name component used to distinguish otherwise similar names on the basis of the relative ages or generations of the persons named. [13.2.1. ]

element.name: nameLink
element.a:documentation: (name link) contains a connecting phrase or link used within a name but not regarded as part of it, such as van der or of. [13.2.1. ]

element.name: addName
element.a:documentation: (additional name) contains an additional name component, such as a nickname, epithet, or alias, or any other descriptive phrase used within a personal name. [13.2.1. ]

element.name: roleName
element.a:documentation: contains a name component which indicates that the referent has a particular role or position in society, such as an official title or rank. [13.2.1. ]

element.name: placeName
element.a:documentation: contains an absolute or relative place name. [13.2.3. ]

element.name: bloc
element.a:documentation: (bloc) contains the name of a geo-political unit consisting of two or more nation states or countries. [13.2.3. ]

element.name: country
element.a:documentation: (country) contains the name of a geo-political unit, such as a nation, country, colony, or commonwealth, larger than or administratively superior to a region and smaller than a bloc. [13.2.3. ]

element.name: region
element.a:documentation: contains the name of an administrative unit such as a state, province, or county, larger than a settlement, but smaller than a country. [13.2.3. ]

element.name: district
element.a:documentation: contains the name of any kind of subdivision of a settlement, such as a parish, ward, or other administrative or geographic unit. [13.2.3. ]

element.name: settlement
element.a:documentation: contains the name of a settlement such as a city, town, or village identified as a single geo-political or administrative unit. [13.2.3. ]

element.name: offset
element.a:documentation: that part of a relative temporal or spatial expression which indicates the direction of the offset between the two place names, dates, or times involved in the expression. [13.2.3. ]

element.name: geogName
element.a:documentation: (geographical name) a name associated with some geographical feature such as Windrush Valley or Mount Sinai. [13.2.3. ]

element.name: geogFeat
element.a:documentation: (geographical feature name) contains a common noun identifying some geographical feature contained within a geographic name, such as valley, mount, etc. [13.2.3. ]

element.name: affiliation
element.a:documentation: (affiliation) contains an informal description of a person's present or past affiliation with some organization, for example an employer or sponsor. [15.2.2. ]

element.name: age
element.a:documentation: (age) specifies the age of a person.

attribute.name: value
attribute.a:documentation: supplies a numeric code representing the age or age group

element.name: birth
element.a:documentation: (birth) contains information about a person's birth, such as its date and place. [15.2.2. ]

element.name: climate
element.a:documentation: (climate) contains information about the physical climate of a place.

element.name: death
element.a:documentation: (death) contains information about a person's death, such as its date and place. [15.2.2. ]

element.name: education
element.a:documentation: contains a description of the educational experience of a person. [15.2.2. ]

element.name: event
element.a:documentation: (event) contains data relating to any kind of significant event associated with a person, place, or organization.

attribute.name: where
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the location of an event by pointing to a place element

element.name: faith
element.a:documentation: specifies the faith, religion, or belief set of a person.

element.name: floruit
element.a:documentation: contains information about a person's period of activity.

element.name: geo
element.a:documentation: (geographical coordinates) contains any expression of a set of geographic coordinates, representing a point, line, or area on the surface of the earth in some notation.

element.name: langKnowledge
element.a:documentation: (language knowledge) summarizes the state of a person's linguistic knowledge, either as prose or by a list of langKnown elements.

attribute.name: tags
attribute.a:documentation: supplies one or more valid language tags for the languages specified

element.name: langKnown
element.a:documentation: (language known) summarizes the state of a person's linguistic competence, i.e., knowledge of a single language. [15.2.2. ]

attribute.name: tag
attribute.a:documentation: supplies a valid language tag for the language concerned.

attribute.name: level
attribute.a:documentation: a code indicating the person's level of knowledge for this language

element.name: listOrg
element.a:documentation: (list of organizations) contains a list of elements, each of which provides information about an identifiable organization. [13.2.2. ]

element.name: listEvent
element.a:documentation: (list of events) contains a list of descriptions, each of which provides information about an identifiable event.

element.name: listPerson
element.a:documentation: (list of persons) contains a list of descriptions, each of which provides information about an identifiable person or a group of people, for example the participants in a language interaction, or the people referred to in a historical source. [15.2. 2.4. 15.3.2. ]

element.name: listPlace
element.a:documentation: (list of places) contains a list of places, optionally followed by a list of relationships (other than containment) defined amongst them.

element.name: location
element.a:documentation: defines the location of a place as a set of geographical coordinates, in terms of a other named geo-political entities, or as an address.

element.name: nationality
element.a:documentation: contains an informal description of a person's present or past nationality or citizenship. [15.2.2. ]

element.name: occupation
element.a:documentation: contains an informal description of a person's trade, profession or occupation. [15.2.2. ]

attribute.name: scheme
attribute.a:documentation: identifies the classification system or taxonomy in use by supplying the identifier of a taxonomy element typically but not necessarily elsewhere in the current document header.

attribute.name: code
attribute.a:documentation: identifies an occupation code defined within the classification system or taxonomy defined by the scheme attribute.

element.name: org
element.a:documentation: (organization) provides information about an identifiable organization such as a business, a tribe, or any other grouping of people. [13.2.2. ]

attribute.name: role
attribute.a:documentation: specifies a primary role or classification for the organization.

element.name: listRelation
element.a:documentation: provides information about relationships identified amongst people, places, and organizations, either informally as prose or as formally expressed relation links. [15.2.2. ]

element.name: relationGrp
element.a:documentation: (relation group) provides information about relationships identified amongst people, places, and organizations, either informally as prose or as formally expressed relation links. [15.2.2. ]

element.name: person
element.a:documentation: provides information about an identifiable individual, for example a participant in a language interaction, or a person referred to in a historical source. [15.2.2. ]

attribute.name: role
attribute.a:documentation: specifies a primary role or classification for the person.

attribute.name: sex
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the sex of the person.

attribute.name: age
attribute.a:documentation: specifies an age group for the person.

element.name: personGrp
element.a:documentation: (personal group) describes a group of individuals treated as a single person for analytic purposes. [15.2.2. ]

attribute.name: role
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the role of this group of participants in the interaction.

attribute.name: sex
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the sex of the participant group.

attribute.name: age
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the age group of the participants.

attribute.name: size
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the size or approximate size of the group.

element.name: place
element.a:documentation: contains data about a geographic location

element.name: population
element.a:documentation: contains information about the population of a place.

element.name: relation
element.a:documentation: (relationship) describes any kind of relationship or linkage amongst a specified group of objects, places, events or people. [15.2.2. ]

rule.report: Only one of the attributes 'active' and 'mutual' may be supplied
the attribute 'passive' may be supplied only if the attribute 'active' is supplied

attribute.name: type
attribute.a:documentation: categorizes the relationship in some respect, e.g. as social, personal or other. Suggested values include: 1] social; 2] personal; 3] other

choice.a:documentation: relationship concerned with social roles
relationship concerned with personal roles, e.g. kinship, marriage, etc.
other kinds of relationship

attribute.name: name
attribute.a:documentation: supplies a name for the kind of relationship of which this is an instance.

attribute.name: passive
attribute.a:documentation: identifies the passive participants in a non-mutual relationship.

attribute.name: active
attribute.a:documentation: identifies the active participants in a non-mutual relationship, or all the participants in a mutual one.

attribute.name: mutual
attribute.a:documentation: supplies a list of participants amongst all of whom the relationship holds equally.

element.name: residence
element.a:documentation: (residence) describes a person's present or past places of residence. [15.2.2. ]

element.name: sex
element.a:documentation: specifies the sex of a person.

element.name: socecStatus
element.a:documentation: (socio-economic status) contains an informal description of a person's perceived social or economic status. [15.2.2. ]

attribute.name: scheme
attribute.a:documentation: identifies the classification system or taxonomy in use.

attribute.name: code
attribute.a:documentation: identifies a status code defined within the classification system or taxonomy defined by the source attribute.

element.name: terrain
element.a:documentation: contains information about the physical terrain of a place.

element.name: trait
element.a:documentation: contains a description of some status or quality attributed to a person, place, or organization typically, but not necessarily, independent of the volition or action of the holder and usually not at some specific time or for a specific date range.

element.name: nym
element.a:documentation: (canonical name) contains the definition for a canonical name or namepart of any kind. [13.3.5. ]

attribute.name: parts
attribute.a:documentation: points to constituent nyms

element.name: listNym
element.a:documentation: (list of canonical names) contains a list of nyms, that is, standardized names for any thing. [13.3.5. ]

attribute.name: when-iso
attribute.a:documentation: supplies the value of a date or time in a standard form.

attribute.name: notBefore-iso
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the earliest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

attribute.name: notAfter-iso
attribute.a:documentation: specifies the latest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

attribute.name: from-iso
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the starting point of the period in standard form.

attribute.name: to-iso
attribute.a:documentation: indicates the ending point of the period in standard form.
